content.description: Start on decent holds at around head height on the NW arete (left hand) and crack on the boulder's west face (right hand).  Compress a couple moves up until you gain the good high left crimp or jug at the lip.  Mantle for the top out or use holds above the first ledge to get your feet up.
content.protection: Pad or two if you need it.
content.location: This climb is on the west side of the obvious proud boulder situated on the ridgeline a few hundred feet west of the summit of Bald Peak.  If you are on the trail, you can't miss it-- you can see the boulder from the summit and it runs right to it.

content.description: Climb the north face beginning with the two-hand crimpy jug at head height, then moving up through good crimps/jugs.  Can also head right-ish for the topout.
content.location: This climb is on the north side of the obvious proud boulder situated on the ridgeline a few hundred feet west of the summit of Bald Peak.  If you are on the trail, you can't miss it-- you can see the boulder from the summit and it runs right to it.

content.description: Smaller peak in the Giant Mountain wilderness.  There is at least one excellent aesthetic boulder near the summit, and may be more undeveloped climbing nearby.
